metadata.title: CVE-2023-39198 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the QXL driver in the Linux kernel. Theqxl_mode_dumb_create() function dereferences the qobj returned by theqxl_gem_object_create_with_handle(), but the handle is the only one holdinga reference to it. This flaw allows an attacker to guess the returnedhandle value and trigger a use-after-free issue, potentially leading to adenial of service or privilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
